alert.note: Alert for Christian; Douglas; Webster (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 3:17AM CDT until July 31 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR EASTERN CHRISTIAN, WESTERN DOUGLAS AND SOUTHERN WEBSTER COUNTIES... At 317 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms that produced the earlier heavy rainfall have moved out of and ended across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain fell across the area. Even through the rainfall has ended, runoff from the early heavy rainfall will continue through the early morning hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Seymour, Fordland, Diggins, Elkhead, Keltner, Bruner, Dogwood, Oldfield, Goodhope, Chadwick, Garrison, Rome, Christian Center and Selmore. This includes the following low water crossings... Beaver Creek at County Road 524, North Spring Creek at County Road 406, Bull Creek at Center Road, Little Beaver Creek at County Road 447, Swan Creek at Swan Cave Road, Finley River at Johns Ford Road and Cowskin Creek at Highway Y. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
